caption: Extremely bizarre, NOT covid safe pick-up situation. Upon walking into the restaurant I saw three grown men lying in the dining room on the banquettes, covered up in blankets and not wearing masks. TF is that about?! Then two dudes walk out of the kitchen also not wearing masks. The only guy wearing a mask was the one who went to grab my order. I wanted to ask what in god’s name was going on but didn’t want to be exposed to what looked like potentially sick people any longer than I already had. I’ve ordered delivery from here numerous time and love their food but I completely lost my appetite after that experience. There are way too many restaurants who are struggling to stay open and actually care about keeping their community healthy by following covid-safe protocol. Dhania is not one of them.
Get food, environment

Just tried this place out yesterday. Mild and mediocre unfortunately. Overpriced. I think the source of the 5 star reviews are transplants with no tastebuds. The most disappointing thing was the Garlic Naan - dry, no butter or fresh herbs - just garlic from the jar. And they give you one for 3.50. Smoky chicken wings had more color than flavor. Alu tikki and fish pepper fry were alright but again very mild in flavor. I wouldn’t recommend. Unwanted leftovers.
People got food poisoning with the Soup.

Delicious food - prepared well and quick delivery. I’ve been searching for the perfect Indian restaurant. Think I found it!!  Everything was fresh and nothing leaked in transit.  I will definitely order again
Food is consistently tasty; best I've found in the neighborhood. Price/portion ratio is great especially for the lunch specials.

Vegetarians/Vegans ordering delivery:BEWARE. If the vegetarian/vegan dish you ordered is ”out” you will, to your surprise, receive a meal with meat. Im honestly so upset since I cannot eat what i was anticipating & spent more than enough money on. I ordered Chana Masala & received a chicken based dish because “they were out”, without as much as a call asking if this substitution was okay—which it would not have been. A literal waste of money and the food arrived cold. Ugh. Do not recommend.
This place is worth a try. They serve big portions for affordable rates. Always well kept and with fantastic ambience. Will come visit again.
Quick service. Amazing flavor and good portions. Would highly recommend.

Ordered for pickup and it was quick and easy! Good portions, the samosas were perfect, and really solid food all around. Ordered one dish spicy and 2 medium and will mostly get spicy from now on. The medium level didn’t really do it for us, but other than that it was perfect. Will definitely order from here again!
Food was great! Will definitely order from Dhania again.

I meet with friends this great restaurant quite often! This is my favorite restaurant to to have a good dinner.  I visit this spot routinely. The cooking is very tasty, the team is welcoming and the prices are affordable. I enjoy being in this restaurant over a decent lunch.

This small cozy restaurant has the most delicious Indian cuisine in the neighborhood. Me and my family really loved there food and there service was excellent. There Butter chicken is the best I ever had, we also ordered Saag paneer and chicken Tikka masala which were delicious. I recommend everyone to at least give it a try you won't regret it.
Excellent food. Nice staff
I love this place so much. So glad this opened up in the neighborhood. I eat year about 3-4 times a week. I think they got a new chef and the food is too good. Check it out!!
Excellent place!! Took my wife here to celebrate her pregnancy. I think the baby enjoyed the food too haha. Felt like I was walking the streets of Mumbai.

The only thing that saved this meal was the naan. The food arrived almost 30 minutes late and was tepid and bland. The paneer was tough, the cauliflower was soggy rather that crispy and the daal was a strange pale brown with undercooked, tough lentils. Other than the chili on the cauliflower none of the food had any flavour. Not somewhere I would recommend!
A great addition to the neighborhood. I had the grilled tandoori veggies and it was well prepared and delicious. Nice atmosphere and friendly service. Will be going back for sure.

I happened to reach the restaurant when it was closed but they didn't refuse to serve infact they were warm and welcoming. The owner is very friendly and service is quick. Food is delicious and healthy. Serve size is huge for a person.
Love this hidden gem! So excited this place opened up. I took my wife to this place for her birthday and we both loved the food!

Sorry to say, but this Indian food was so bland and tasted like it came out of a packet. We love Indian food and unfortunately this did not live up to it. I can only speak of the vegan dishes, but there was no flavor at all, even the naan bread didn’t look like it was freshly made, and didn’t taste like what it should. There are a ton of other Indian places around that taste more genuine.
Omg the food is full of flavor taste the ingredients I love it,I will be back, so if someone is reading this please try the food you will love it as I do hmnnnnmm
Excellent! Their portions are big and the food is delicious. Really good variety of vegan, vegetarian (it is Indian food after all) and meat options as well. Highly recommend!
their food is nice. next to Lirr. Vey convenieny for lunch hour. order the food befor you get there. they will have ready for you.
FIirst of all really friendly environment  cozy and really felt comfortable. The food was top notch.Had tandoori chicken and chicken chops it was delicious. Definitely coming here again
Great food. Went with my wife and kids. Clean environment and great service. Fish jal frezy was great. We plan to go there again.

We’re so happy this place opened! We used to love the old restaurant that was in the same location, but this new one is even better! Food is amazing and fresh! Decor is clean and comfortable. Service is the sweetest ever. So happy you’re in the neighborhood!

First, have to say, the service was just great. Always ready to assist, frequently stealing the words out of my mouth on what I was about to ask for. Next, the food itself- we ordered a couple of different kinds of dishes. The flavor ranged from decently good to inarguably tasty. The atmosphere was alright, it was definitely a clean restaurant though.  Bottom line: The people were warm and hospitable and the food was good. I'm pretty sure you won't be able to find a better spot for Indian food in the neighborhood.
Fast and delicious!
